newsitem.title: LATVIA: LATVIA-MARKET SUPERVISION TO BE BY ONE BODY, ZILE SAYS.
newsitem.headline: LATVIA-MARKET SUPERVISION TO BE BY ONE BODY, ZILE SAYS.

text.p: Finance Minister Robert Zile on Tuesday said he plans to concentrate financial market supervision under one roof, covering both credit, insurance and securities institutions.
"This is a very important project which might take longer (to implement) than my ministerial mandate will last," Zile told a news conference marking his 100 days in office.
"The central bank manages the supervision of the credit institutions very well and the finance ministry is overseeing insurance and securities spheres," Zile said.
"But we have to take into account that new market players will be there next year, private pension funds and investment funds," he said.
Zile said there were considerable savings and increased efficiency in concentrating financial market supervision in single hands.
"This is an accepted practice elsewhere in Scandinavia," he said, referring to the Swedish example where one supervising body of 150 people watches over large market.
